channel.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
channel.description: A friend told me he could pretty much hack any game [b]INCLUDING[/b] runescape using hex-hacking aka Hexadecimal Hacking? Explain? Discuss?

item.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Mitko:

This reminds me a few years ago, when i saw a video on YouTube showing how you edit your money on RuneScape using Cheat Engine, when it worked for me i fell off my chair from happines, i banked or buyed something or w/e and it changed back to normal, was like FFFFUUUUUUUUUCKKKK!@# xD

Yeah, because that’s when the server resends the amount of money you have

Read full topic

item.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Hexadecimal is just another numeric system that uses A-F too. It’s named that because of how it takes 8 bits to assemble a byte (IIRC). Hexadecimal hacking… sigh That’s just called being stupid. Your friend was most likely talking about memory editing, like using cheat engine.

Read full topic

item.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Hexadecimal is a way of representing decimals with base 16. The only chars you can use in hexadecimal are 0-9, A-F.
0-9 representing themselves and A-F representing the numbers from 9-15, A=10,B=11 etc

All programs contain some sort of data which can be represented as decimal and therefore hexadecimal. You can edit this by using a hex-editor however it is rather difficult to find the things that you actually want to edit. Strings are very easy to edit though because most editors allow you to search ascii strings within the code.

For the runescape client, it’s pointless to hex edit it because it’s written in java therefore we can easily modify it using libraries such as BCEL (Byte Code Engineering Library) or even better- reverse engineer the client using a deobfuscater.

Read full topic
item.source: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?

item.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:13, topic:328421”]I wasn’t talking about hex editors…[/quote]That’s what this thread is about. One could only assume that’s what you were getting at… You’re in the wrong here bro ;), plus you went along with my reply after I noted the other hex editor thread:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:328421”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=424809.msg3120164#msg3120164 date=1265472426]
All of the modifications are only visible on your side of the computer. It only effects you and no one else, so I don’t see the point. It would only be something like map shifting if it were possible, so I don’t see how fun it could be.

There was a topic like this before:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


[/quote]
Well isn’t it the client that determines clipping? So if it sends coords to the server to be sent to everyone else, wouldn’t everyone see the same thing?[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?

item.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:328421”][quote author=Stork link=topic=424809.msg3120173#msg3120173 date=1265472907]

Would it be possible to edit the client so that you could walk through walls?
[/quote]All of the modifications are only visible on your side of the computer. It only effects you and no one else, so I don’t see the point. It would only be something like map shifting if it were possible, so I don’t see how fun it could be.

There was a topic like this before:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,400366.msg2969101.html#msg2969101

Well isn’t it the client that determines clipping? So if it sends coords to the server to be sent to everyone else, wouldn’t everyone see the same thing?

No, the server does that stuff too.

After RSC’s massive dupe incident, jagex learnt how to lock down the server pretty well.

Oh ok.[/quote]Plus, as I said in the other thread, hex editors only manipulate or create a false image of what’s really there. It will never change the actual value, so the client’s actual process isn’t affected at all by the hex editor.

Read full topic
item.source: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?

item.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Hex editing can be used to hack some games. I know this because that’s how I got level 55 on COD4 for the PC. As for games such as RuneScape, the only person the “hack” affects is the person using it. It makes no actual changes to the game, just visual.

Read full topic

item.title: What exactly is Hexadecimal or hex-hacking?
item.dc:creator: @R3volution1 R3volution`
item.description:
@R3volution1 wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

ROM hacking

ROM hacking is the process of modifying a ROM image of a video game to alter the game's graphics, dialogue, levels, gameplay, and/or other elements. This is usually done by technically inclined video game fans to breathe new life into a cherished old game, as a creative outlet, or to make essentially new unofficial games using the old game's engine. ROM hacking is generally accomplished through use of a hex editor (a program for editing non-textual data) and various specialized tools such as til...

fun stuff.

Read full topic
